plants.name: Chrysanthemum morifolium
plants.description: Chrysanthemums are popular ornamental flowering plants known for their vibrant and diverse flower forms and colors. They are widely cultivated in gardens and as potted plants and are often associated with autumn blooms.
plants.location: Temperate regions worldwide, notably East Asia and North America
plants.funFact: Chrysanthemums are a symbol of longevity and rejuvenation in many cultures, especially in East Asia.

plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: A flowering shrub prized for its glossy evergreen leaves and large, showy flowers blooming in late autumn through winter. It thrives in mild climates and is often found in gardens and parks.
plants.location: Eastern Asia (Japan, Korea, China), cultivated globally in temperate climates
plants.funFact: Camellia japonica flowers are traditionally used to make tea, with the Camellia genus including the tea plant.

plants.name: Grevillea robusta
plants.description: Grevillea robusta is a fast-growing evergreen tree native to eastern coastal Australia. It produces distinctive bright orange, spider-like flowers that attract birds and pollinators in the spring and early summer, but in some areas, flowering extends into autumn or early winter.
plants.location: Eastern Australia, also cultivated in subtropical regions worldwide
plants.funFact: Despite its common name 'Silky Oak,' it is not a true oak but is valued for its timber and ornamental appeal.

plants.name: Magnolia grandiflora
plants.description: An evergreen tree famous for its large, fragrant white flowers that bloom in late spring through autumn, with some flowers still appearing into early winter in warmer climates.
plants.location: Southeastern United States and cultivated in similar climates globally
plants.funFact: Southern Magnolia flowers have a lemony scent and are quite large, sometimes up to 12 inches across.
